Follows the player, but runs in a random direction screaming if sees a zombie. Does not calm down until no more hostiles visible, then resumes following.
stays where he is, but is somewhat calmed. No longer saying the previous strings randomly.
Tries to make it to the Shining Serpent. Cowers if he sees zombies, so he'll probably die. If he makes it, is it possible to give XP to the plaeyr who told him to go? Chaos adjustment here, I think.

Selected after having been delivered to a safe location
Selected by the party that escorted him
Give reward of xp to the party that escorted him, one time only.

This character is freaking out in a corner displaying these first two strings at random intervals. This character can be convinced to follow the player to safety. If calmed before being told to follow, he will follow closely and only cower when he sees undead. If not calmed, he will run in a random direction screaming when he sees hostiles. He won't stop until no more hostiles are present, and then resumes following. 

If told to run on his own to safety, if he was calmed he tries, but cowers when he sees undead. If told to run and he was not calmed, he runs screaming in a random direction screaming.

Once he begins following he can be spoken to again. Unpacified he repeats his whole dialogue as though beginning again. Pacified he speaks from his secondary dialogue. Player gets extra XP for delivering him to a safe location. Less points for making him run himself, if he makes it.

The player can calm him by either persuading him, being the same race and being nice, or by casting charm or remove fear BEFORE speaking to him.
